Details: Specify a file containing a list of hosts or networks to scan.
Select a specified number of random targets for scanning.
Exclude specific hosts or networks from the scan.
Specify a file containing a list of hosts or networks to scan.
Exclude hosts or networks listed in a file from the scan.

Description: List Scan - simply list targets to scan
Details: Perform a simple listing of targets without scanning them.
Perform a ping scan without attempting to discover open ports.

Description: Treat all hosts as online -- skip host discovery
Details: Bypass host discovery and treat all specified hosts as online.
Specify a file containing a list of hosts or networks to scan.

Description: TCP SYN, TCP ACK, UDP or SCTP discovery to given ports
Details: Send TCP SYN,  TCP ACK,  UDP  or SCTP discovery probes to specified ports.

Description: ICMP echo, timestamp, and netmask request discovery probes
Details: Send ICMP echo,  timestamp  and netmask request discovery probes.
Send IP protocol ping probes using the specified protocols.
Select a specified number of random targets for scanning.

Description: Never do DNS resolution/Always resolve [default: sometimes]
Details: Control DNS resolution behavior during scanning.
Use custom DNS servers for name resolution during scanning.
Use the operating system's default DNS resolver for name resolution.

Description: Trace hop path to each host
Details: Perform a traceroute to each scanned host to show the path taken.
Perform different types of TCP scans: SYN,  Connect,  ACK,  Window,  Maimon.
Perform a scan to discover open UDP ports.

Description: TCP Null, FIN, and Xmas scans
Details: Perform TCP scans with Null,  FIN  or Xmas flags set.
Specify custom TCP scan flags.
Perform an idle scan using a specified zombie host and optional probe port.
Perform SCTP INIT or COOKIE-ECHO scans.
Perform a scan to determine which IP protocols are supported by hosts.
Perform an FTP bounce scan through a specified relay host.
Limit scanning to specified port ranges.

Description: Exclude the specified ports from scanning
Details: Skip scanning of specific ports.

Description: Fast mode - Scan fewer ports than the default scan
Details: Perform a faster scan by reducing the number of scanned ports.
Scan ports in sequential order without randomization.
Limit scanning to the specified number of most common ports.
Specify a ratio to determine which ports to scan based on commonality.

Description: Probe open ports to determine service/version info
Details: Detect services and their versions on open ports.
Control the intensity of service/version detection probes.
Limit service/version detection to probes deemed most likely.
Attempt every possible service/version detection probe.
Select a specified number of random targets for scanning.

Description: Show detailed version scan activity (for debugging)
Details: Display detailed information about service/version detection probes.
Enable default NSE scripts for scripting engine scanning.

Description: <Lua scripts> is a comma separated list of
Details: Specify Lua scripts to execute during scanning.
Pass arguments to NSE scripts during execution.

Description: provide NSE script args in a file
Details: Specify a file containing arguments for NSE scripts.

Description: Show all data sent and received
Details: Display all data sent and received during NSE script execution.
Update the NSE script database with the latest version.
Select a specified number of random targets for scanning.
Display help information for specified Lua scripts.
Detect the operating system of scanned hosts.

Description: Limit OS detection to promising targets
Details: Restrict OS detection to targets showing promising results.
Increase aggressiveness of OS detection guessing.
Select a timing template for scan speed and reliability.
Control the size of parallel host scan groups.
Specify the number of probes to run in parallel during scanning.

Description: Specifies timeout values for round-trip time during scanning.
Caps number of port scan probe retransmissions
Details: Limit the number of retransmissions for port scan probes.

Description: Give up on target after this long
Details: Specify a timeout duration after which scanning a target is aborted.
Set a delay between scan probes  with optional maximum delay.

Description: Send packets no slower than <number> per second
Details: Set a minimum rate for sending packets during scanning.

Description: Send packets no faster than <number> per second
Details: Set a maximum rate for sending packets during scanning.
Fragment packets during scanning,  optionally specifying MTU size.
Conduct a scan using decoy IP addresses to hide the origin.
Use a specified IP address as the source address for scan packets.
Select a specific network interface for sending scan packets.
Specify a particular source port number for scan packets.
Route scan connections through specified HTTP or SOCKS4 proxies.

Description: Append a custom payload to sent packets
Details: Include a custom hexadecimal payload in packets sent during scanning.

Description: Append a custom ASCII string to sent packets
Details: Append a custom ASCII string to packets sent during scanning.

Description: Append random data to sent packets
Details: Include random data in packets sent during scanning,  up to a specified length.

Description: Send packets with specified ip options
Details: Include specified IP options in packets sent during scanning.
Set the Time-To-Live (TTL) value in IP packets sent during scanning.
Use a specified MAC address or prefix as the source MAC address for scan packets.

Description: Send packets with a bogus TCP/UDP/SCTP checksum
Details: Send packets with an intentionally incorrect TCP, UDP or SCTP checksum during scanning.

Description:
Output scan in normal, XML, s|<rIpt kIddi3,Output scan results in one or more formats: normal, XML, s|<rIpt kIddi3,
-oA <basename>,Output in the three major formats at once,Generate output in all major formats: normal, XML, and s|<rIpt kIddi3,
-v,Increase verbosity level (use -vv or more for greater effect),Increase verbosity level to show more detailed scan information.
-d,Increase debugging level (use -dd or more for greater effect),Increase debugging level to provide extensive debug information.
--reason,Display the reason a port is in a particular state,Show the reason why a port is in a specific state during scanning.
--open,Only show open (or possibly open) ports,Display only open or possibly open ports in scan results.
--packet-trace,Show all packets sent and received,Log and display all packets sent and received during scanning.
--iflist,Print host interfaces and routes (for debugging),Print information about host interfaces and routes for debugging purposes.
--append-output,Append to rather than clobber specified output files,Append scan results to specified output files instead of overwriting them.
--resume <filename>,Resume an aborted scan,Resume a previously interrupted scan using a specified resume file.
--noninteractive,Disable runtime interactions via keyboard,Disable interactive prompts and interactions during scanning.
--stylesheet <path/URL>,XSL stylesheet to transform XML output to HTML,Use an XSL stylesheet to convert XML scan output into HTML format.
--webxml,Reference stylesheet from Nmap.Org for more portable XML,Reference Nmap.Org's stylesheet for more portable XML scan output.
--no-stylesheet,Prevent associating of XSL stylesheet w/XML output,Disable association of any XSL stylesheet with XML scan output.
-6,Enable IPv6 scanning,Enable scanning of IPv6 addresses and networks.
-A,Enable OS detection
Details: version detection,  script scanning,  and traceroute, Enable comprehensive scanning including OS detection  version detection  script scanning  and traceroute functionality.
